result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth P. Minck Jr.

records.addlTxt:
(12:18 PM cases 22CF1071, 22CF1078 called.) Defendant Kenneth P. Minck Jr. in court. Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Kenneth P. Minck Jr. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 22CF1071, 22CF1078 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts, which the Court accepts.
Attorney Knaak advises is close to a resolution as does have an offer from the State which the defendant requests to review further.
Attorney Knaak requests a status conference for possible plea about 45-60 days out.
Attorney Knaak relays the offer to the Court.
Court has colloquy with the defendant regarding offer and ability to successfully complete probation.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF1071 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF1071 Count 1.

Court imposes and stays 10 days jail with Huber privileges and 2 days credit. Court places the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Restitution plus 5% and 10% surcharges to be determined within 30 days. Any remaining charges including case 22CF1078 are dismissed and read in.
Court orders the term of probation may end early after 6 months if the probation agent deems appropriate.

(11:19 AM cases 22CF1071, 22CF1078 called.) Defendant Kenneth P. Minck Jr. does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Kenneth P. Minck Jr. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Knaak advises the defendant was previously homeless and has no further information for the defendant's non-appearance.
State requests warrants.
Court orders warrants, $50.00 or body only.

(11:53 AM cases 22CF1071, 22CF1078 called.) Defendant Kenneth P. Minck Jr. in court. Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Kenneth P. Minck Jr. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders the warrants are quashed and bonds continue.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF1071, 22CF1078 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Knaak to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

1:38 PM Cases called: 22CF1071 & 22CF1078. Defendant Kenneth P. Minck Jr. not in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Kenneth P. Minck Jr.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was in court when this date and time was set. State requests a warrant in both cases. Warrant ordered.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Removing Count 1- Felony Bail Jumping.
Renumbering Counts 2-3 to Counts 1-2.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.  
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm. 

Not mailed to Defendant as address indicates "Homeless".

(Case called at 11:08 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Kenneth Minck Jr. appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Andrew Knaack. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. State requests $100 cash bond. Defense requests larger signature bond. Court orders $1,000 signature bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 09/27/2022 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Not mailed to Defendant as address indicates "Homeless".
